page.title: 18Trimpley Reservoir- Utility
page.content: Part of the Severn Trent Water Authority,the reservoir covers 29acres with a top collecting pool 40ft deep & a bottom mud lagoon. Built in 1966, it adds 30 million galls/day to the Elan Valley Aqueduct for Birmingham.Locally it supplies parts of Mamble and Tenbury.Water is pumped from the River Severn, spread over the collecting pool, and piped to the waterworks to be chemically treated and filtered before passing into the pipeline from Wales.The thick mud waste is collected in the mud lagoon and left to settle, clean water returning to the river. The reservoir had to be built around a Yew tree protected by a preservation order, interrupting the otherwise perfect oval. Imported from India many years ago, the tree is said to be the only one of its kind in the country.
